texts.label: text
texts.orig: When you need to measure network throughput and capacity, I haven't found a simpler solution than  iperf . There isn't  much to say  about the operation of iperf — it's a very simple application.
texts.text: When you need to measure network throughput and capacity, I haven't found a simpler solution than  iperf . There isn't  much to say  about the operation of iperf — it's a very simple application.

texts.label: text

texts.orig: The client side will try to shove TCP packets through the network interface as quickly as possible for a period of 10 seconds by default. Once that's complete, you'll see a report on the server and client that will look like this:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The previous test was run over an 802.11n network between a wired and wireless device. The  typical downlink  for an 802.11n network is about 40Mbit/s, so it's obvious that my home network could use an adjustment.
texts.text: The previous test was run over an 802.11n network between a wired and wireless device. The  typical downlink  for an 802.11n network is about 40Mbit/s, so it's obvious that my home network could use an adjustment.
